mil3.6.3:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil3.6.3:0.3_0: and learning the marks of a great man.
mil3.6.3:1.2_0: “Susīma, the Buddha has possessed the thirty-two marks of a great man, and the color of gold coins and bullion?”
mil3.6.3:1.3_0: “Great king, the Buddha has thirty-two marks of a great man to speak of golden garlands and fragrances. Your skin is dismayed, if he disappointed, and based on the meal.”
mil3.6.3:2.1_0: “Sir, what do the thirty-two marks of a great man have been handed down by the armpit of gold coins and bullion?”
mil3.6.3:2.2_0: “Parks of the thirty-two marks of a great man,
mil3.6.3:3.11_0: “In the same way, the Buddha possesses the thirty-two marks of a great man. And he speaks well-to-do brahmins, and householders. He makes us reconciles and runs, we rejoiced in the heavenly realm, and possessed the thirty-two marks of a great man.”
mil3.6.3:3.1_0: “This being so, Sir, there’s no comparison that arises by the Buddha.”
mil3.6.3:3.2_0: A senior monk who brought the following:
mil3.6.3:3.3_0: “But great king, is there any pink lotus pond?”
mil3.6.3:3.7_0: “Great king, why is the scent of the wind?”
mil3.6.3:3.9_0: “What, water, or by loved by the wind?”
mil3.6.3:5.1_0: and the third marks of a great man.
